## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(tidylog)
library(lubridate)
library(ggthemes)
library(readr)
library(ggsci)
library(showtext)
library(sysfonts)
```

```{r}
data <- read_csv("./progress tracker.csv", skip=3) |>
  select(2:6) |>
  slice(1:13) |>
  clean_names()
data
```
```{r}
data$date <- as.Date(data$date, format = "%m/%d/%y")
data$date <- format(data$date, "%m/%d")
```
```{r}
data$success_rate <- as.numeric(sub("%","",data$success_rate))
```
```{r}
font_add(
  family = "IndustriaSolid",
  regular="/Users/jiayu/Library/Fonts/Industria Solid.otf")
font_add(
  family="UrbanSkate",
  regular="/Users/jiayu/Library/Fonts/UrbanSkate.otf")
showtext_auto()
```

```{r}
p1 <- ggplot(data=data) +
  geom_line(aes(x=date, y=success_rate, col=obstacle, group=obstacle),linewidth = 1.2) +
  geom_point(aes(x=date, y=success_rate, col=obstacle), size=2) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    breaks = seq(0,100, by=20),
    labels = function(x) paste0(x,"%")
  ) +
  labs(
    title="Ollie Progress Tracker",
    x="Date", 
    y="Success Rate", 
    color = "Obstacle Size") +
  theme_fivethirtyeight() +
  scale_color_manual(
    values=c("#E71D36", "#97CE4C","#59CBE8")) +
  guides(color=guide_legend(reverse=TRUE)) +
  theme(
    plot.title=element_text(family="UrbanSkate",size=32, margin=margin(10,0,20,0)),
    axis.title.x=element_text(family="IndustriaSolid", size=24, margin=margin(5,0,5,0)),
    axis.title.y=element_text(family="IndustriaSolid", size=24, margin=margin(0,5,0,5)),
    legend.title=element_text(family="IndustriaSolid", size=24, margin=margin(5,0,5,0)),
    axis.text=element_text(family="IndustriaSolid", size=16))

print(p1)
```
```{r}
ggsave("ollie tracker.pdf", height=6, width=10)
```
